title: NASA’s Glenn Research Center Director to Retire
summary: NASA announced Monday Dr. Marla Pérez-Davis, director of NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland, plans to retire in June after nearly four decades of service at the agency.

title: South Korea’s new president seeks independent space agency, deeper US space cooperation
summary: South Korea’s newly elected president Yoon Suk-yeol will take office May 10 with a set of ambitious space projects aimed at making the country a major space power by 2035.

title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-3 to Discuss Mission After Returning to Earth
summary: Astronauts of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-3 mission, including crew members from NASA and ESA (European Space Agency), will answer questions about their recent mission aboard the International Space Station during a post-splashdown news conference at 11:45 a.m. EDT Wednesday, May 11.

title: CACI to launch experimental satellite to demonstrate alternative to GPS navigation
summary: CACI International is funding an experiment to demonstrate space technologies for military use, including an alternative to GPS navigation.

title: As Centaur turns 60 years old, ULA prepares to evolve Centaur V
summary: 60 years ago, on May 8, 1962, Atlas-LV3C Centaur-A – designated Atlas Centaur-1 (AC-1) – lifted off from the newly-constructed Launch Complex-36A (LC-36A). AC-1 was the first flight test of the hydrogen-powered Centaur upper stage. Since the maiden flight of Centaur, the stage has flown on several different rocket families across six decades. Centaur has launched military, commercial, and science missions allowing access to every planetary body in the solar system and even beyond.
